name: Harlem River Park Banks
description: Steep banks along the Harlem River with raw street spots scattered throughout. Not for beginners.
history: Discovered by uptown crews in the late 2000s. Still relatively unknown to the broader scene.
bestTimes: Weekday afternoons. Bring wax — the ledges need love.
transitDirections: 2/3 to 135th St, walk east to the river.

detailedNotes.terrain: Features include banks, ledges, gaps, stairs. Urban architecture repurposed for skating.
detailedNotes.culture: Part of the Manhattan skate scene in Harlem. Discovered by uptown crews in the late 2000s. Still relatively unknown to the broader scene.
detailedNotes.tips: Best approach: 2/3 to 135th St, walk east to the river.. Weekday afternoons. Bring wax — the ledges need love.
detailedNotes.warnings: Street spot — be respectful of the space and watch for security.
